shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Daily Office Prayers and Litanies (fols. 5ra-26ra) II) Śǝrʿatä qǝddase “Ordinary of the Mass” (fols. 26ra-50rb) III) Anaphoras (fols. 50va-153ra) III-1) Anaphora of the Apostles (fols. 50va-60va) III-2) Anaphora of Our Lord Jesus Christ (fols. 61rb-64rb), preceded by an excerpt from “The Book of the Testament” (fols. 60va-61rb) III-3) Anaphora of Our Lady by St. Cyriacus of Behnesa (fols. 64va-74vb) III-4) Anaphora of St. John, son of Thunder (fols. 75ra-84vb) III-5) Anaphora of the 318 Orthodox Fathers of Nicaea (fols. 85ra-93rb) III-6) Anaphora of St. Athanasius of Alexandria (fols. 93va-105rb) III-7) Anaphora of St. John Chrysostom (fols. 105va-111rb) III-8) Anaphora of St. Jacob of Serug (fols. 111va-118rb) III-9) Anaphora of St. Gregory (“Hosanna-liturgy of St. Gregory”) (fols. 118va-124vb) III-10) Anaphora of St. Basil of Caesarea (fols. 125ra-134rb) III-11) Anaphora of St. Epiphanius of Cyprus (fols. 134ra-140vb) III-12) Anaphora of St. Dioscorus of Alexandria (fols. 140va-143rb) III-13) Anaphora of St. Cyril of Alexandria (fols. 143va-149vb) III-14) Second Anaphora of St. Gregory (“Christmas-liturgy of St. Gregory”) (fols. 149vb-153ra)
Additiones 1-8.

copyists.copyist: According to Additio 6, the commissioner was ras Sǝbḥat.

donors.donor: Kidanä Maryam (baptismal name of ras Sǝbḥat, mentioned in supplication formulas on fols. 50va, 61rb, 75ra, etc.).

owners.owner: ras Sǝbḥat (s. ownership note, Additio 2) whose baptismal name is Kidanä Maryam (s. ownership note, Additio 6).

dcomments.dcomment: Fols. 11rb, 23va: Mǝnilǝk is mentioned as the ruling King. Fol. 121vb: Qerǝllos is mentioned as the Patriarch and Ṗeṭros as the Metropolitan (or bishop). Mǝnilǝk II was the Emperor of Ethiopia in 1889-1913, Cyril V was the Patriarch of Alexandria in 1874-1927, Ṗeṭros IV was the Metropolitan of Ethiopia in 1881-89, subsequently serving as the bishop of the northern territories.

txstates.txstate: Many leaves are stained with dirt.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with dark-brown leather. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bnothers.bnother: Small holes and tears are visible on the spine folds of the quires, close to the head and the tail. The leather on the inner sides of the boards is reddish-brown.

squires.squire: A(4/fols. 1r-4v) – ፩I(10/fols. 5r-14v) – ፪II(10/fols. 15r-24v) – ፫III(10/fols. 25r-34v) – ፬IV(10/s. l.: 3, 8, stubs after 3, 8/fols. 35r-44v) – ፭V(10/fols. 45r-54v) – ፮VI(10/s. l.: 3, 8, stubs after 3, 8/fols. 55r-64v) – ፯VII(10/fols. 65r-74v) – ፰VIII(10/fols. 75r-84v) – ፱IX(10/fols. 85r-94v) – ፲X(10/fols. 95r-104v) – ፲፩XI(10/fols. 105r-114v) – ፲፪XII(10/fols. 115r-124v) – ፲፫XIII(10/fols. 125r-134v) – ፲፬XIV(10/fols. 135r-144v) – ፲፭XV(10/fols. 145r-154v) – B(4/fols. 155r-158v)

taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are mostly visible. Ruling pricks are mostly visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

rubrications.rubrication:
Nomina sacra; name of the ruling King; headings and incipits of the constituent texts; directives for the ministers; some of the musical notation signs above the lines; most of the abbreviations; elements of decorated quire marks; elements of the punctuation signs and Ethiopic numbers.
The incipit pages of most of the constituent texts are written alternately in red and black lines (s. fols. 5r, 29r, 50v, 61rb, 64v, 75r, etc.).

abbreviations.abbreviation: ይካ፡ for ይበል፡ ካህን፡ ይዲ፡ for ይበል፡ ዲያቆን፡ ይሕ፡ for ይበል፡ ሕዝብ፡ እማ፡ for እማሬ፡ እግ፡ አም፡ for እግዚአብሔር፡ አምላክነ፡ እግ፡ ተሣ፡ for እግዚኦ፡ ተሣሀለነ፡ ጸ፡ በእን፡ for ጸልዩ፡ በእንተ፡ ንበ፡ ኵል፡ for ንበል፡ ኵልነ፡ እግ፡ ዘኵ፡ ትእ፡ ንስ፡ ወና፡ for እግዚእ፡ ዘኵሎ፡ ትእኅዝ፡ ንስእለከ፡ ወናስተበቍዓከ፡ ይርከ፡ ሣ፡ እ፡ for ይርከበነ፡ ሣህልከ፡ እግዚኦ፡ በእ፡ ነ፡ ገብር፡ እኁ፡ እገ፡ for በእንተ፡ ገብርከ፡ እኁነ፡ እገሌ፡

otherdetails.otherdetail: Liturgical indications (directives) concerning particular Anaphoras are written partly in Gǝʿǝz, partly in Amharic (s. fols. 111rb, 118rb, etc.).

additional.cont: Fol. 3r: Exhortation to the brethren, incomplete.
additional.add: Fol. 3r: ኦአንትሙ፡ ማህበረ፡ ሐዋርያት፡ ኩኑ፡ ብሩካነ፡ ወንጹሃነ፡ ለዓም፡ ሞገሥወሰላም፡ ይኵንክሙ። እግዚአብሔር፡ ለዓም፡ አሜን። አነገብርክሙ፡ ወል፡
Fol. 4v: ዝመጽሐፈ፡ ቅዳሴ፡ ዘራስ፡ ስብሐት፡ ዘሠረቆ፡ ወዘፈሐቆ፡ በሥልጣነ፡ ጴጥሮስ፡ {ወጳውሎስ፡} በ፲ወ፪ሐዋርያት፡ በ፸ወ፪አርድእት፡ በ፫፻፲ወ፰ርቱዓነ፡ ሃይማኖት፡ ውጉዘ፡ ለይን [sic]።
additional.tran: [Fol. 4v]: This is a Missal of ras Sǝbḥat. He who stole it or erased (its text) shall be excommunicated by the authority of Peter and Paul, of the twelve apostles, of the seventy two disciples, of the three hundred and eighteen Orthodox (Fathers).

additional.cont: Fol. 153ra-rb: Exhortation to commemorate the owner and his relatives.
Fol. 153rb: Names of some of the owner’s relatives (?).
Fol. 153rb: Scribe’s note on completing the writing.
additional.add: Fol. 153rb: ስብሐት፡ ለአብ፡ ወወልድ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ለዓለም፡ ወለዓለመ፡ ለዘአፈጸመኒ፡ በዳህና፡ ወበሰላም፡ አሜን።
additional.tran: [Fol. 153rb]: Praise be to the Father, and the Son, and the Holy Spirit, forever and ever, to Him who has enabled me to complete (this work) in safety and in peace. Amen.

additional.cont: Fol. 153va-vb: Extensive ownership note and supplication for the souls of the persons mentioned.
additional.add: Fol. 153va-vb: ዝ፡ መጽሐፈ፡ ቅዳሴ፡ ዘራስ፡ ስብሐት፡ ወስመ፡ ክርስትናሁ፡ ኪዳነ፡ ማርያም፡ ወስመ፡ ብእሲቱ፡ ወለተ፡ ማርያም፡ ወስመ፡ ደቂቁኒ፡ ገብረ፡ ሕይወት፡ ወልደ፡ ገብርኤል፡ አርአያ፡ ሥላሴ፡ አረጋዊ፡ ገብረ፡ ሥላሴ፡ ኃይለ፡ ማርያም፡ ወአንስትኒ፡ እለ፡ ተወልዳ፡ እምኔሁ፡ ለራስ፡ ስብሐት፡ ወለተ፡ ሥላሴ፡ ወለተ፡ ማርያም፡ ሥምረተ፡ አብ፡ እግዚእ፡ ኃረያ፡ ወለተ፡ አረጋዊ፡…
additional.det: The note mentions the names of many of the owner’s relatives.

additional.cont: Fol. 154ra-rb: Names of several persons with indications of kinship ties between them.

additional.det: The text of the note is identical to the text of Additio 2.

extras.extra: - Crude notes: fols. 1r, 156r, 157r, 158v. - Crude notes in the upper margin: fols. 40r, 47r. - Crude notes in the bottom margin: fols. 41r, 45r. - Stamps of seals, beneath Additio 2 and between Additiones 4 and 5: fols. 4v, 153r. - Pen trial, in red ink: fol. 158r. - Pen trial, in black ink: fol. 158v.

txquiremarks.txquiremark: - Decorated quire numbers are written in the upper and bottom margins of fols. 55r: ፮, 65r: ፯, 85r: ፱, 95r: ፲, 105r: ፲፩, 115r: ፲፪, 125r: ፲፫, 135r: ፲፬, 145r: ፲፭. The rest of the quire numbers are not decorated.

frames.frame: 1) Wide uncoloured ornamental band over col. a-b, at the incipit of text I, with a pair of ails on the top and interlaces and floral ornamentation motifs: fol. 5r. 2) Wide uncoloured ornamental band over col. a-b, at the incipit of the Mi mäṭän prayer, with a pair of ails on the top and interlaces and floral ornamentation motifs: fol. 29r. 3) Wide uncoloured ornamental band over col. a-b, at the incipit of text III-1, with a pair of ails on the top, a palmette in the centre and interlaces and floral ornamentation motifs: fol. 50v. 4) Narrow uncoloured ornamental band over col. b, at the incipit of text III-2, with interlaces and floral ornamentation motifs: fol. 61rb. 5) Wide uncoloured ornamental band over col. a-b, at the incipit of text III-3, with a pair of ails on the top and interlaces and floral ornamentation motifs: fol. 64v. 6) Wide uncoloured ornamental band over col. a-b, at the incipit of text III-4, with a pair of ails on the top, a palmette in the centre and interlaces and floral ornamentation motifs: fol. 75r. 7) Wide uncoloured ornamental band over col. a-b, at the incipit of text III-5, with interlaces and floral ornamentation motifs: fol. 85r. 8) Wide uncoloured ornamental band over col. a-b, at the incipit of text III-6, with a pair of ails on the top and interlaces and floral ornamentation motifs: fol. 93v. 9) Wide uncoloured ornamental band over col. a-b, at the incipit of text III-7, with a pair of ails on the top and interlaces and floral ornamentation motifs: fol. 105v. 10) Wide uncoloured ornamental band over col. a-b, at the incipit of text III-8. Greater part of the band is very faded: fol. 111v. 11) Wide uncoloured ornamental band over col. a-b, at the incipit of text III-9, with interlaces: fol. 118v. 12) Wide uncoloured ornamental band over col. a-b, at the incipit of text III-10, with a pair of ails on the top and interlaces: fol. 125v. 13) Wide uncoloured ornamental band over col. a-b, at the incipit of text III-11, with interlaces: fol. 134r. 14) Two pairs of uncoloured lines, with an empty space between them, over the incipit of text III-12: fol. 140v. 15) Pair of uncoloured lines over the incipit of text III-13: fol. 143v. 16) Two pairs of uncoloured lines, with an empty space between them, over the incipit of text III-14: fol. 149vb.
